from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import re
import logging
import time
from ...autoval_exceptions import TestError
from ...autoval import AutovalUtils
from ...fbjbod_utils import FbjbodUtils
from ...disk_utils import DiskUtils
from ...generic_utils import GenericUtils
from ...storage.smart_validation_abstract import SmartValidationAbstract
from ...sdparm_utils import SdparmUtils



[docs]class SMARTInfoSas(SmartValidationAbstract):

[docs]    def __init__(self, drive, external_file=None):
        self.autoval_utils = AutovalUtils()
        self.blockname = drive
        if (external_file) and ('sas' in external_file):
            self.external_file = GenericUtils.load_validate_config(external_file['sas'])
        else:
            self.external_file = GenericUtils.load_validate_config(
                "smart_hdd_check_sas.txt")
        self.data = self.get_data(drive)


    def __getattr__(self, name):
        return getattr(self.autoval_utils, name)


[docs]    def get_smart_output(self, device):
        cmd = "smartctl -x /dev/%s" % (device)
        try:
            out = self.run_get_output(cmd)
        except Exception:
            raise TestError(
                "Failed to get SMART output for device: %s" % device
            )
        return out


    def _extract_field(self, field, out, pattern):
        m = re.search(pattern, out)
        if m:
            return m.group(1)
        else:
            raise TestError("Didn't find %s in SMART output" % (field))

    def _get_device_manufacturer(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Vendor:\s+([a-zA-Z]+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('manufacturer', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_serial_number(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Serial number:\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('serial number', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_fw_version(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Revision:\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('firmware version', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_user_capacity(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'User Capacity:\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('user capacity', out, pattern)
        capacity = field.replace(",", "")
        return capacity

    def _get_model_number(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Product:\s+(\w+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('device model', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_sector_size(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Logical block size:\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('sector size', out, pattern)
        return field


[docs]    def get_counter_fields(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'Invalid DWORD count:\s+(\S+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('Invalid DWORD count', out, pattern)
        return field



[docs]    def get_common_fields(self, device, out):
        fields = {}
        fields.update({'manufacturer': self._get_device_manufacturer(out)})
        fields.update({'logical_drive': device})
        fields.update({'serial_number': self._get_serial_number(out)})
        fields.update({'firmware_version': self._get_fw_version(out)})
        fields.update({'user_capacity': self._get_user_capacity(out)})
        fields.update({'sector_size': self._get_sector_size(out)})
        fields.update({'model': self._get_model_number(out)})
        fields.update({'device_health': self._get_health_status(out)})
        fields.update(
            {'read_uncorrected_errors': self._get_uncorrected_read_errors(out)}
        )
        fields.update(
            {
                'write_uncorrected_errors':
                self._get_uncorrected_write_errors(out)
            }
        )
        fields.update(self._get_target_error(out))
        fields.update(
            {'element_in_grown_defect': self._get_element_in_grown_defect(out)}
        )
        return fields


    def _get_uncorrected_read_errors(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(
            r'read:\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+.\w+\s+(\w+)',
            re.MULTILINE
        )
        field = self._extract_field('read uncorrected errors', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_uncorrected_write_errors(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(
            r'write:\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+\s+\w+.\w+\s+(\w+)',
            re.MULTILINE
        )
        field = self._extract_field('write uncorrected errors', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_target_error(self, out):
        data = {}
        found = False
        for line in out.split('\n'):
            if re.search(
                'attached device type: no device attached', line, re.M
            ):
                found = False
                continue
            if re.search('attached device type: expander device', line, re.M):
                found = True
                continue
            if found:
                patt1 = r"Invalid DWORD count = (\w+)"
                patt2 = r"Running disparity error count = (\w+)"
                patt3 = r"Loss of DWORD synchronization = (\w+)"
                patt4 = r"Phy reset problem = (\w+)"
                patt5 = r"Invalid word count:\s+(\w+)"
                patt6 = r"Running disparity error count:\s+(\w+)"
                patt7 = r"Loss of dword synchronization count:\s+(\w+)"
                patt8 = r"Phy reset problem count:\s+(\w+)"

                m = re.search(patt1, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Invalid DWORD count"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt2, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["disparity error count"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt3, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Loss of DWORD synchronization"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt4, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Phy reset problem"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt5, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Invalid word count"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt6, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Phy event disparity error count"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt7, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Loss of dword synchronization count"] = int(count)
                m = re.search(patt8, line)
                if m:
                    count = m.group(1)
                    data["Phy reset problem count"] = int(count)
        return data

    def _get_element_in_grown_defect(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(
            r'Elements in grown defect list:\s+(\w+)', re.MULTILINE
        )
        field = self._extract_field('Elements in grown defect', out, pattern)
        return field

    def _get_health_status(self, out):
        pattern = re.compile(r'SMART Health Status:\s+(\w+)', re.MULTILINE)
        field = self._extract_field('Health Status', out, pattern)
        return field


[docs]    def to_config_dict(self, smart_data):
        """
        Transforms smart_data dict as generated by self.get_data into
        human readable key value pairs that can be stored in test config data
        """
        smart_values = {}
        for key, value in smart_data.items():
            smart_dict = {key: value}
            smart_values.update(smart_dict)
        return smart_values



[docs]    def get_data(self, device):
        smart_data = {}
        out = self.get_smart_output(device)
        smart_data["type"] = DiskUtils.get_device_type(device)
        smart_data["interface"] = "sas"
        smart_data.update(self.get_common_fields(device, out))
        return smart_data



[docs]    def validate_rules(self, smart_data, smart_attr_dict=None):
        """
        Validates SMART min / max attribute rules as defined in
        self.attribute_desc. Raises an exception if any errors found
        @param smart_data: Parsed SMART data as generated by self.get_data
        """
        logging.info("Validating SMART rules")



[docs]    def compare_attributes(self, config1, config2, devices, json_data=None):
        for dev in devices:
            dev_start_config = config1[dev]
            dev_end_config = config2[dev]
            if self.compare_dict(dev_start_config, dev_end_config):
                continue
            else:
                return False
        return True



[docs]    def compare_dict(self, d1, d2):
        diff_in_smart = AutovalUtils.compare_configs(d1, d2)
        if diff_in_smart:
            self.log_info(
                "the difference in smart data is %s" % (diff_in_smart)
            )
            return False
        return True



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def update_firmware(versions, upgrade, devices, mode=False, fw_slot=''):
        """
        Update a set of firmware on a list of devices.

        @param {} versions: dictionary of version info. Earlier versions should have
        lower indices than later versions.
        @param bool upgrade: True means upgrade
        """
        my_list = range(0, len(versions))
        if not upgrade:
            my_list.reverse()
        my_list.pop()
        for i in my_list:
            if upgrade:
                v = i + 1
            else:
                v = i - 1
            firmware_file = versions[v]['filename']
            cmd = 'lspci | grep -i lsi'
            output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            if re.search(
                'Serial Attached SCSI controller', output, re.M | re.I
            ):
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Found Serial Attached SCSI controller")
                slot_nums = SMARTInfoSas.get_sas_devices_slot_numbers()
                for i in range(len(slot_nums)):
                    SMARTInfoSas.update_sas_device_firmware(
                        slot_nums[i], firmware_file
                    )
            elif re.search('RAID bus controller', output, re.M | re.I):
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Found RAID bus controller")
                enc_dev_id, slot_num = SMARTInfoSas.get_raid_devices_enc_n_slot_ids()
                for i in range(len(enc_dev_id)):
                    for j in range(len(slot_num)):
                        SMARTInfoSas.update_raid_device_firmware(
                            enc_dev_id[i], slot_num[j],
                            firmware_file
                        )
            else:
                raise TestError("No supported target device found")

            AutovalUtils.log_info("Powering off all slots")
            FbjbodUtils.poweroff_allhddslot()
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Powering on all slots")
            FbjbodUtils.poweron_allhddslot()
            SMARTInfoSas.check_version(versions[v]['version'], devices)



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def check_version(version, devices):
        firmware_output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("sg_map -i")
        num = len(re.findall(version, firmware_output))
        if (num != len(devices)):
            raise TestError(
                'One or more drive are not with version %s' % (version)
            )



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_sas_devices_slot_numbers():
        cmd = 'lsiutil -p1 -a 19,,0,0 20'
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        line_num = 0
        device_num = []
        for line in output.split("\n"):
            line_num += 1
            if re.search(r"\s+B___T\s+Type\s+Vendor\s+Product\s+Rev", line):
                break
        for line in output.split("\n")[line_num:]:
            m = re.search(r"(\d+).\s+\d+\s+\d+\s+Disk", line)
            if m:
                device_no = m.group(1)
                device_num.append(int(device_no))
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "Device Number(s): [%s]" % (','.join(map(str, device_num)))
            )
        return device_num



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def update_sas_device_firmware(device_num, filename):
        try:
            cmd = "lsiutil -p1 -a 19,%d,,,Yes,0,0,0,0 -f %s 20" % (
                device_num, filename
            )
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing command: %s" % cmd)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            # Adding delay to avoid failure doing back to back FW upgrade.
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Going to wait for 15 secs.")
            time.sleep(15)
        except Exception as e:
            raise TestError(
                "lsiutil command failed for device no %d: %s" %
                (device_num, str(e))
            )



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_raid_devices_enc_n_slot_ids():
        enclosure_device_id = []
        slot_number = []
        cmd = "megacli -PDList -aALL"
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        for line in output.split("\n"):
            m = re.search(r"^Enclosure Device ID: (\d+)", line)
            n = re.search(r"^Slot Number: (\d+)", line)
            if m:
                val = m.group(1)
                enclosure_device_id.append(int(val))
            elif n:
                val = n.group(1)
                slot_number.append(int(val))
            else:
                continue
        enclosure_device_id = list(set(enclosure_device_id))
        AutovalUtils.log_info(
            "Enclosure Device ID(s): [%s]" %
            (','.join(map(str, enclosure_device_id)))
        )
        AutovalUtils.log_info(
            "Slot Number(s): [%s]" % (','.join(map(str, slot_number)))
        )
        return (enclosure_device_id, slot_number)



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def update_raid_device_firmware(
        enclosure_device_id, slot_number, filename
    ):
        try:
            cmd = (
                "megacli -PdFwDownload -PhysDrv[%d:%d] "
                "-f %s -a0" % (enclosure_device_id, slot_number, filename)
            )
            logging.log_info("Executing command: %s" % cmd)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            # Adding delay to avoid failure doing back to back FW upgrade.
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Going to wait for 30 secs.")
            time.sleep(30)
        except Exception as e:
            raise TestError(
                "megacli command failed for device no %d: %s" %
                (slot_number, str(e))
            )



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def writecache_get(drive):
        """

        @param str device: path of drive under /dev/ (e.g. sdb)
        @return int: 1 for enabled, 0 or disabled
        """
        return SdparmUtils.get_writecache_state(drive)



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def writecache_enable(drive, save=False):
        """

        @param str device: path of drive under /dev/ (e.g. sdb)
        @param boolean save: if True will set current mode and the saved mode
        """
        SdparmUtils.writecache_enable(drive, save=save)



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def writecache_disable(drive, save=False):
        SdparmUtils.writecache_disable(drive, save=save)

    def read_lookahead_get(drive):
        return SdparmUtils.get_readlookahead_state(drive)

        SdparmUtils.read_lookahead_disable(drive, save=save)
